medical_history.chief_complaint: Stiffness, swelling, and severe pain in the right thumb and both ankles.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms developed 9 days before admission, starting with stiffness, swelling, and pain in the metacarpophalangeal joint of the right thumb, which limited her ability to perform tasks. Six days before admission, swelling and pain in both ankles developed, with progressive worsening of joint pain despite a 6-day tapering course of oral methylprednisolone.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of stroke and glaucoma; underwent total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy for menorrhagia 7 years prior.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in New England, works in health care, widowed, sexually active with one male partner, no pets, does not drink alcohol, use tobacco or illicit drugs.
